meanings.definition: To make French in form or character.
meanings.sent1: She decided to gallicize her wardrobe by adding berets and striped shirts.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant gallicized its menu by adding escargot and coq au vin.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to gallicize itself by wearing a tiny beret.
meanings.sent4: The old building seemed to gallicize under the influence of the French artist's paintings.
meanings.sent5: The garden was gallicized with lavender and rosemary, giving it a French charm.

meanings.definition: To adopt French customs or manners.
meanings.sent1: The students decided to gallicize their greeting by kissing on both cheeks.
meanings.sent2: She quickly gallicized her behavior by always carrying a baguette.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to gallicize its nap time by curling up on a French flag.
meanings.sent4: The town square seemed to gallicize during the French festival with music and dancing.
meanings.sent5: The office atmosphere was gallicized with a relaxed attitude and long lunches.

meanings.sent1: He had to gallicize the document for the French embassy.
meanings.sent2: The book was gallicized for the French market with a new title and cover.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to gallicize the instructions but ended up with a recipe for croissants.
meanings.sent4: Her words were gallicized in his mind, taking on a poetic and elegant tone.
meanings.sent5: The song lyrics were gallicized beautifully, capturing the essence of the original emotion.
